New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder moved to 7-0 with a 102-86 win, extending their NBA record of winning their first 7 games by at least 12 or more points
86 points allowed is a new season low for the Thunder
Key Match Events: Jalen Williams scored 14 points on 6-for-8 shooting in the opening frame
Isaiah Joe made three straight triples from the 2:19 to 1:15 stretch to extend the Thunder lead to 24 points
Pre-Game Insights: Without injured starters Paolo Banchero and Wendell Carter Jr., the Magic started their fourth different group of the year
Post-Match Reflections: Chet Holmgren recorded 14 points, nine rebounds and two blocks before leaving the game with an injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder put together their best offensive quarter in the year to start the game, scoring 39 first-quarter points on 15-for-21 (71.4%) shooting
Others: The Thunder will play their second road matchup against the Nuggets Nov 6 at 8 p.m. CST
